questions.question: What feeling was growing in England during the Elizabethan period?
questions.explanation: The Elizabethan period was marked by growing patriotism and pride in being English.

questions.question: Which English explorers sought new trade routes during the Elizabethan era?
questions.explanation: English explorers aimed to expand trade into the Spanish colonies in the Americas.

questions.question: Who was one of the commanders in the defeat of the Spanish Armada?
questions.explanation: Sir Francis Drake was one of the commanders who helped defeat the Spanish Armada.

questions.question: What was the name of Sir Francis Drake’s ship?
questions.explanation: Drake’s ship, the Golden Hind, was one of the first to circumnavigate the world.

questions.question: Which coast did English settlers first begin to colonise in America?
questions.explanation: English settlers began to colonise the eastern coast of America during Elizabeth I’s reign.

questions.question: Who is regarded as the greatest writer in the English language?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare is widely seen as the greatest writer in the English language.

questions.question: Where was William Shakespeare born?
questions.explanation: Shakespeare was born in Stratford-upon-Avon, England.

questions.question: Which play includes the line 'To be or not to be'?
questions.explanation: The famous line 'To be or not to be' is from Hamlet.

questions.question: What is the Globe Theatre in London?
choices: A modern copy of original theatres
questions.explanation: The Globe Theatre is a modern copy of the theatres where Shakespeare’s plays were performed.

questions.question: Who became king after Elizabeth I died in 1603?
questions.explanation: James VI of Scotland became James I of England after Elizabeth I’s death.

questions.question: Which countries did James I rule over?
questions.explanation: James I ruled England, Wales, Ireland, and Scotland.

questions.question: What was one major achievement of King James’s reign?
questions.explanation: King James commissioned a new translation of the Bible, known as the King James Version.

questions.question: What was the King James Bible also called?
questions.explanation: The King James Bible is also known as the Authorised Version.

questions.question: Which English king took the title 'King of Ireland'?
questions.explanation: Henry VIII took the title 'King of Ireland'.

questions.question: What were the Protestant settlements in Ireland called?
questions.explanation: The Protestant settlements in Ireland were known as plantations.

questions.question: Which province in Ireland did Protestants mainly settle?
questions.explanation: Scottish and English Protestants mainly settled in Ulster, the northern province of Ireland.

questions.question: Who managed Parliament skilfully?
questions.explanation: Elizabeth I managed Parliament skilfully, balancing her wishes with its views.

questions.question: What idea did James I and Charles I believe in?
questions.explanation: James I and Charles I believed in the Divine Right of Kings — that they ruled by God’s will.

questions.question: How long did Charles I rule without Parliament?
questions.explanation: Charles I ruled without Parliament for 11 years.

questions.question: What caused Charles I to recall Parliament?
questions.explanation: Charles I was forced to recall Parliament due to trouble in Scotland.
